flashcards.title: DMV California Practice Flashcards - Set 3
flashcards.description: 15 essential DMV questions covering lane changes, U-turns, cargo rules, and school zones for California driving test

cards.question: If five or more vehicles are following you on a narrow two-lane road:
cards.answer: drive into the turnout areas or lanes to let them pass

cards.question: Which of these is a legal U-turn?
cards.answer: on a divided highway where there is a paved opening for a turn

cards.question: You see a car approaching from the rear. When you check your mirror again to change lanes, you no longer see the car:
cards.answer: look over your shoulder to be sure the car isn't in your blind spot

cards.question: If you are towing another vehicle or trailer on a freeway with four lanes in your direction, you may travel in:
cards.answer: either of the two right lanes

cards.question: This red and white sign means you should:
cards.answer: give the right-of-way to traffic on the road you wish to enter or cross

cards.question: To be sure a lane is clear before you change lanes, you should:
cards.answer: glance over your shoulder into the lane you want to enter

cards.question: When driving in fog, snow, or rain you should use your:
Which of these statements is true about child passengers?
cards.answer: children under the age one should not ride in the front seat in airbag-equipped vehicles

cards.question: All of the following are dangerous while driving. Which is also illegal?
cards.answer: wearing a headset that covers both ears

cards.question: You should stop before crossing railroad tracks:
cards.answer: any time a train may be approaching, whether or not you can see it

cards.question: To turn left from a one-way street, start from:
cards.answer: the lane closest to the left curb

cards.question: Cargo extending more than four feet from your rear bumper:
cards.answer: must be marked with a red flag or lights

cards.question: A pedestrian who is blind or is visually impaired uses traffic sounds before deciding to cross the street. If you see a pedestrian with a guide dog or white cane waiting to cross at a corner, you should:
cards.answer: pull up to the crosswalk so the person can hear your engine

cards.question: Two vehicles are approaching an uncontrolled "T" intersection. One vehicle is on the through road and the other is on the road that ends. Who has the right-of-way at the intersection?
cards.answer: the vehicle on the through road

cards.question: The speed limit for a school zone where children are present is ____.
